TopicTitle: WW2 BAD-T - World War 2 BDArmory AI Dogfight Tournament [FINISHED]

Articles.Content:
Ok so this was amazing:

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/oClwo8bp1PY?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>
That crash was awesome!
That was amazing. Thanks a ton for organising the first round of BAD-T. It was truly entertaining. Can't wait for the second part of the tournament in which I will (hopefully) take a part.

That was quite the battle. For the next tourney,will the Jumo (presumably thrust limited to ~50% or so) be allowed? If so, it will be interesting to see if Jets make an appearance this time, and how they'll compare to the top tier prop planes we've just seen.
From what i have seen from the battles, it isn't so much the speed that matters but the planes maneuverability that counts. I guess thrust vectoring engines could help with it.

While jet battles are indeed cool you should check out Wanderfound's tournament for those.

I think that I will focus on piston monoplanes for the next BAD-T, unless someone else wants to run the other battles, in that cass I could set up the rules etc.

Yes maneuverability won, but that was mainly an AI thing, you will notice that the Maelstorm only died when it flew straight.

I would actually be interested in building a Juno-powered aircraft, but AJE would probably be needed for those. If the jet battles were held separately from prop planes I would definitely participate in that.

So we are not going to use AJE, the new AI does not like to conservate energy.

Instead the engines will receive tweaks and will be distributed on a pack dedicated for this challenge, that makes things much simpler to handle.
It would be awesome if SQUAD added propeller engines in 1.1 ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Setting up modpack for BAD-T v2!  

This includes and is not limited to Aviator Arsenal 1.1, custom SXT propellers and a FAR update :3
I haven't even tried the new BD autopilot yet, I noticed there's a few more settings to play with. Do you think it's worth waiting for KSP1.1 or am I being too optimistic thinking it's close?

Unless KSP 1.1 comes in a hurry (which is unlikely), we are not going to wait for it.

Think about it like this, after this update almost every mod is expected to break, and people will want to play with the new version.

While we wait for the mods to update and everyone to have fun with stock KSP, I run the battles ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Edit: Something worth mentioning is that the next BAD-T version will have a small classificatory step, your airplane will be required to destroy a target in order to classify.

This is to make sure the airplanes are on a decent flight condition.

But, to be fair: Contestants - For tetryds' convenience when setting up battles, it might be a good idea to note in the description of any submitted craft whether or not it can take off in 260 meters or less.
